comments.raw_text:
IMO http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/association-of-controls-and-forms.html#concept-form-submit doesn't say yes, it seems to assume that the document always exist. The steps assume that there is a form browsing context and there would be no such thing if there is no form document, isn't it?

For example, what would happen if you try to submit a form out of a document with no action attribute? Where the data are going to be sent?

comments.raw_text:
> it seems to assume that the document always exist.

"the document" for purposes of that text is the ownerDocument.  So yes, it's assumed to always exist.  I hate this part about the spec; when it says "the form's Document" it means the ownerDocument.

> The steps assume that there is a form browsing context

No, step 2 bails out if the form's ownerDocument doesn't have a browsing context.
